meanings.definition: A vehicle for conveying the dead to the place of burial.
meanings.sent1: The hearse slowly carried the deceased to the cemetery.
meanings.sent2: The funeral procession included a black hearse.
meanings.sent3: The hearse driver made sure to drive respectfully and carefully.
meanings.sent4: The hearse's somber presence reminded everyone of the solemn occasion.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the hearse brought tears to the mourners' eyes.

meanings.definition: To convey or transport in a hearse.
meanings.sent1: They hearsed the body to the graveyard for the burial.
meanings.sent2: The funeral director hearsed the deceased with dignity.
meanings.sent3: It was a strange sight to see them hearse the casket up the hill.
meanings.sent4: The team carefully hearsed the coffin into the waiting vehicle.
meanings.sent5: She hearsed the deceased with utmost respect and care.
